Key Match Events: Havertz (56') and Gross (89') scored for Germany
Pre-Game Insights: Germany welcome Greece to Borussia-Park on Friday night for their final warm-up fixture before hosting Euro 2024.

Germany boss Nagelsmann is able to call upon Toni Kroos, Antonio Rudiger and Niclas Fullkrug and Nico Schlotterbeck who were all absent against Ukraine after being granted extra time off following their involvement in last weekend's Champions League final.

Greece are gearing up for their first fixture since March when they were eliminated from Euro 2024 qualifying following a heart-breaking penalty-shootout defeat in a playoff semi-final against Georgia.
Post-Match Reflections: Germany won the match 2-1 against Greece.
Greece have lost their last three encounters by an aggregate score of 10-4 against Germany.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany's top scorer in the Nagelsmann era is Niclas Fullkrug with four goals from six matches.

Germany will be keen to make a swift return to winning ways on Friday against a Greece outfit whom they have beaten in six of their previous nine meetings, scoring at least twice on all six occasions.
